009package Ch13_ColorImages;
010
011import java.awt.Point;
012import java.awt.image.ColorModel;
013import java.awt.image.IndexColorModel;
014
015import ij.IJ;
016import ij.ImagePlus;
017import ij.gui.PointRoi;
018import ij.gui.Roi;
019import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
020import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
021
022/**
023 * Makes a specific color of the current (index) color image 
024 * transparent.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 *
028 */
029public class Make_Index_Transparent implements PlugInFilter {
030        
031        static int tidx = 2;    // index of transparent color
032        
033        private ImagePlus im;
034        
035        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
036                this.im = im;
037                return DOES_8C + ROI_REQUIRED + NO_CHANGES;     // this plugin works on indexed color images 
038        }
039
040        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
041                ColorModel cm =  ip.getColorModel();
042                if (!(cm instanceof IndexColorModel)) {
043                        IJ.showMessage("Color model not of type IndexedColorModel");
044                        return;
045                }
046                
047                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
048                if (!(roi instanceof PointRoi)) {
049                        IJ.showMessage("point ROI required");
050                        return;
051                }
052                
053                PointRoi proi = (PointRoi) roi;
054                Point p = proi.getContainedPoints()[0];
055                tidx = ip.get(p.x, p.y);
056                
057                IJ.log("transparent pixel index = " + tidx);
058                        
059                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip.duplicate();
060                
061                
062                IndexColorModel icm = (IndexColorModel) cm; 
063                IJ.log("Color Model=" + ip2.getColorModel() + " " + ip2.isColorLut());
064                
065        
066                int pixBits = icm.getPixelSize(); 
067                int nColors = icm.getMapSize(); 
068                
069                //retrieve the current lookup tables (maps) for R,G,B
070                byte[] tRed = new byte[nColors]; icm.getReds(tRed);  
071                byte[] tGrn = new byte[nColors]; icm.getGreens(tGrn);  
072                byte[] tBlu = new byte[nColors]; icm.getBlues(tBlu);  
073                
074                // Set the color table for the transparent pixel to gray.
075                // Note that ImageJ always shows the transparent pixels 'white'.
076                // GIF export works as expected, pixels are actually transparent.
077                // PNG export does not consider transparency but inserts the associated
078                // color from the color table.
079                byte gray = (byte) (0xFF & 200);
080                tRed[tidx] = gray;      
081                tGrn[tidx] = gray;
082                tBlu[tidx] = gray;
083                
084                //create a new color model and apply to the image
085                IndexColorModel icm2 = new IndexColorModel(pixBits, nColors, tRed, tGrn, tBlu, tidx);  
086                IJ.log("transparency = " + icm.getTransparency());
087
088                ip2.setColorModel(icm2);
089                ImagePlus im2 = new ImagePlus(im.getTitle() + "-tranparent", ip2);
090                im2.setTypeToColor256();
091                im2.show();
092        }
093
094}
095
